artifacts.content:
{
  "market_analysis": {
    "tam": {
      "value": "$2.1 billion",
      "calculation": "Total addressable market for developer tools, based on Gartner's estimate of the global DevOps tooling market in 2023.",
      "source_type": "industry_report"
    },
    "sam": {
      "value": "$1.2 billion",
      "calculation": "Estimated serviceable addressable market, focusing on the enterprise segment of developers and engineering teams using CI/CD tools.",
      "geographic_scope": "Global"
    },
    "som": {
      "value": "$240 million",
      "calculation": "Projected serviceable obtainable market in the first 3 years, assuming 20% market capture based on the product's differentiation and target user segment.",
      "assumptions": [
        "Strong adoption among enterprise customers",
        "Effective marketing and sales strategy",
        "Continuous product improvements"
      ]
    },
    "growth_rate": "12% CAGR",
    "market_stage": "growing",
    "timing_assessment": "The market for developer tools is experiencing rapid growth, driven by the increasing adoption of DevOps practices and the need for more visibility and control over the software development lifecycle. This is the optimal time to launch a product that addresses the pain points of power users and developers."
  },
  "competitors": [
    {
      "name": "Jenkins",
      "type": "direct",
      "description": "Open-source continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) server",
      "strengths": [
        "Widely adopted",
        "Highly customizable",
        "Large community"
      ],
      "weaknesses": [
        "Complex setup and configuration",
        "Limited UI/UX",
        "Steep learning curve"
      ],
      "pricing": "Open-source (free)",
      "market_share_estimate": "30%",
      "key_differentiator": "Flexibility and extensibility",
      "threat_level": "high"
    },
    {
      "name": "GitLab",
      "type": "direct",
      "description": "All-in-one DevOps platform with built-in CI/CD",
      "strengths": [
        "Integrated solution",
        "Enterprise-grade features",
        "Rapid development"
      ],
      "weaknesses": [
        "Steep learning curve",
        "Limited customization",
        "Performance issues"
      ],
      "pricing": "$19/user/month",
      "market_share_estimate": "25%",
      "key_differentiator": "Comprehensive DevOps toolchain",
      "threat_level": "high"
    },
    {
      "name": "Azure DevOps",
      "type": "indirect",
      "description": "Microsoft's DevOps solution, integrated with Azure cloud",
      "strengths": [
        "Tight integration with Azure",
        "Enterprise-level support",
        "Large user base"
      ],
      "weaknesses": [
        "Vendor lock-in",
        "Limited cross-platform support",
        "Expensive for non-Azure users"
      ],
      "pricing": "$6-$135/user/month",
      "market_share_estimate": "20%",
      "key_differentiator": "Azure ecosystem integration",
      "threat_level": "medium"
    }
  ],
  "trends": [
    {
      "trend": "Shift-left testing and security",
      "type": "technology",
      "impact": "Increased demand for tools that integrate security and testing earlier in the development lifecycle",
      "timeline": "Current",
      "confidence": "high"
    },
    {
      "trend": "Hybrid and multi-cloud adoption",
      "type": "technology",
      "impact": "Need for tools that support diverse cloud and on-premises infrastructure",
      "timeline": "1-2 years",
      "confidence": "high"
    },
    {
      "trend": "Emphasis on developer experience",
      "type": "consumer",
      "impact": "Increased focus on user-friendly interfaces and workflows for developers and engineering teams",
      "timeline": "Current",
      "confidence": "high"
    },
    {
      "trend": "Regulatory compliance and governance",
      "type": "regulatory",
      "impact": "Requirement for tools that provide visibility, traceability, and compliance features",
      "timeline": "Current",
      "confidence": "high"
    }
  ],
  "swot": {
    "strengths": [
      "Focused on the needs of power users and developers",
      "Leverages the latest Next.js and React technologies",
      "Ability to integrate with a wide range of CI/CD tools and cloud platforms"
    ],
    "weaknesses": [
      "Lack of brand recognition compared to established players",
      "Potentially higher development and maintenance costs due to the use of newer technologies",
      "Limited resources for initial marketing and sales efforts"
    ],
    "opportunities": [
      "Underserved need for a user-friendly, highly customizable CI/CD dashboard",
      "Potential to integrate with emerging technologies like AI-powered code analysis and workflow automation",
      "Ability to target the growing enterprise segment with a focus on compliance and governance"
    ],
    "threats": [
      "Continued dominance of established players like Jenkins and GitLab",
      "Potential for larger tech companies to release competing products with significant resources",
      "Rapid changes in the DevOps landscape and the need to continuously adapt the product"
    ]
  },
  "opportunities": [
    "Provide a highly customizable and user-friendly CI/CD dashboard that caters to the needs of power users and developers",
    "Differentiate by integrating advanced features like AI-powered code analysis, workflow automation, and compliance management"
  ],
  "risks": [
    {
      "risk": "Difficulty in gaining market share against established competitors",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "high",
      "mitigation": "Focus on a clear value proposition, targeted marketing, and building a strong community of users"
    },
    {
      "risk": "Rapid changes in the DevOps landscape requiring frequent product updates",
      "probability": "high",
      "impact": "medium",
      "mitigation": "Adopt a flexible and modular architecture to enable quick adaptations, and maintain a strong R&D focus"
    },
    {
      "risk": "Potential security and compliance issues due to the sensitive nature of the data handled",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "high",
      "mitigation": "Implement robust security and compliance measures, and obtain relevant certifications and audits"
    }
  ],
  "recommendation": {
    "market_attractiveness": "8/10 - Significant growth potential, clear differentiation opportunities, and a focus on an underserved segment",
    "entry_timing": "now",
    "key_success_factors": [
      "Exceptional user experience and customization capabilities",
      "Seamless integration with a wide range of CI/CD tools and cloud platforms",
      "Innovative features that address emerging trends like shift-left testing and compliance management",
      "Effective marketing and sales strategy to build brand awareness and customer acquisition"
    ]
  }
}

{
  "mvp_definition": {
    "core_value_proposition": "A comprehensive build monitoring dashboard that gives developers and power users visibility into the progress and status of their OLYMPUS builds",
    "target_user": "Developers and technical leaders responsible for managing and understanding OLYMPUS builds",
    "key_differentiator": "Provides a single pane of glass for all build-related information, from phase progression to agent status to constitutional compliance - empowering users to quickly identify and resolve issues."
  },
  "mvp_features": [
    {
      "id": "build_list",
      "name": "Build List Panel",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 90,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 10,
        "impact": 9,
        "confidence": 10,
        "effort": 7
      },
      "description": "Displays a list of active and completed builds with status indicators, timestamps, and duration.",
      "user_story": "As a developer, I want to see a list of all my builds so I can quickly understand the status and progress of each one."
    },
    {
      "id": "phase_progression",
      "name": "Phase Progression Panel",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 88,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 9,
        "impact": 9,
        "confidence": 9,
        "effort": 8
      },
      "description": "Provides a visual timeline of the build phases, including status indicators and explanations for each phase.",
      "user_story": "As a technical leader, I want to see the progress of my build through the different phases so I can identify bottlenecks and unblock my team."
    },
    {
      "id": "agent_roster",
      "name": "Agent Roster Panel",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 85,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 9,
        "impact": 8,
        "confidence": 9,
        "effort": 8
      },
      "description": "Lists all 35 agents involved in the build, showing their current status and the task they're working on.",
      "user_story": "As a developer, I want to see who is working on my build and what they're doing so I can understand the overall progress and identify any blockers."
    },
    {
      "id": "constitutional_status",
      "name": "Constitutional Status Panel",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 88,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 9,
        "impact": 9,
        "confidence": 9,
        "effort": 8
      },
      "description": "Displays a traffic light system for up to 7 constitutional checks, showing the status and a brief explanation for each.",
      "user_story": "As a technical leader, I want to see the constitutional compliance status of my build so I can ensure it meets the required standards before deployment."
    },
    {
      "id": "understanding_panel",
      "name": "Understanding Your Build Panel",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 85,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 8,
        "impact": 9,
        "confidence": 8,
        "effort": 8
      },
      "description": "Provides information about what was built, why it was built that way, and any known risks.",
      "user_story": "As a developer, I want to understand the rationale behind the decisions made during my build so I can learn from the process and improve my future builds."
    },
    {
      "id": "contextual_chat",
      "name": "Contextual Chat Panel",
      "category": "supporting",
      "priority": "should_have",
      "rice_score": 75,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 7,
        "impact": 7,
        "confidence": 8,
        "effort": 8
      },
      "description": "Allows users to ask questions about the current build in a collapsible side panel.",
      "user_story": "As a developer, I want to be able to ask questions about my build and get immediate answers from the system or other users, so I can unblock myself and make progress more efficiently."
    }
  ],
  "roadmap": {
    "phase_1_mvp": {
      "duration": "4-6 weeks",
      "features": [
        "build_list",
        "phase_progression",
        "agent_roster",
        "constitutional_status"
      ],
      "milestone": "Minimum Viable Product - Build monitoring dashboard"
    },
    "phase_2_enhance": {
      "duration": "2-4 weeks",
      "features": [
        "understanding_panel"
      ],
      "milestone": "Enhanced build understanding"
    },
    "phase_3_scale": {
      "duration": "2-4 weeks",
      "features": [
        "contextual_chat"
      ],
      "milestone": "Collaborative build exploration"
    }
  },
  "technical_requirements": {
    "stack": {
      "frontend": "Next.js 14 + React 18 + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS",
      "backend": "Next.js API Routes",
      "database": "Supabase",
      "auth": "Supabase Auth"
    },
    "integrations": [
      "Supabase (for API endpoints and real-time updates)",
      "Lucide React (for icons)"
    ],
    "performance": {
      "initial_load": "<3s",
      "interaction_response": "<500ms",
      "lighthouse_target": ">90"
    },
    "security": [
      "HTTPS",
      "JWT-based authentication",
      "Input sanitization"
    ]
  },
  "success_criteria": {
    "launch_requirements": [
      "All critical features functional",
      "No TypeScript errors",
      "Responsive on desktop",
      "Core user flows completable end-to-end"
    ],
    "validation_metrics": [
      "Users can navigate the build dashboard and find the information they need in under 2 minutes",
      "Zero critical bugs in core user flows",
      "Positive user feedback on the overall experience and usefulness of the dashboard"
    ]
  },
  "featureChecklist": {
    "critical": [
      {
        "id": "build_list",
        "name": "Build List Panel",
        "description": "Displays a list of active and completed builds with status indicators, timestamps, and duration.",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a table with columns for build ID, status (queued, running, completed, failed), start time, end time, and duration",
          "Status indicators use appropriate colors (green for completed, yellow for running, red for failed)",
          "Clicking on a build row navigates to the individual build detail view",
          "No hardcoded data - pulls from /api/builds endpoint"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 1,
        "rice_score": 90
      },
      {
        "id": "phase_progression",
        "name": "Phase Progression Panel",
        "description": "Provides a visual timeline of the build phases, including status indicators and explanations for each phase.",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a horizontal timeline with the following phases: discovery, design, architecture, frontend, backend, integration, testing, deployment",
          "Each phase shows a status indicator (pending, active, completed, failed) and a brief explanation of what that phase entails",
          "Phases are color-coded based on status (green for completed, yellow for active, red for failed)",
          "Clicking on a phase navigates to the individual build detail view and scrolls to that phase"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 2,
        "rice_score": 88
      },
      {
        "id": "agent_roster",
        "name": "Agent Roster Panel",
        "description": "Lists all 35 agents involved in the build, showing their current status and the task they're working on.",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a list of all 35 agents, organized by build phase",
          "Each agent card shows the agent's name, role, current status (idle, working, completed, failed), and the task they're currently working on",
          "Status indicators use appropriate colors (green for completed, yellow for working, gray for idle)",
          "Clicking on an agent card navigates to the individual build detail view and scrolls to that agent's phase"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 3,
        "rice_score": 85
      },
      {
        "id": "constitutional_status",
        "name": "Constitutional Status Panel",
        "description": "Displays a traffic light system for up to 7 constitutional checks, showing the status and a brief explanation for each.",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays up to 7 constitutional checks in a compact, traffic light-style layout",
          "Each check shows the article name, status (compliant, warning, violation), and a one-sentence explanation",
          "Status indicators use appropriate colors (green for compliant, yellow for warning, red for violation)",
          "Clicking on a check navigates to the individual build detail view and scrolls to the relevant section"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 4,
        "rice_score": 88
      },
      {
        "id": "understanding_panel",
        "name": "Understanding Your Build Panel",
        "description": "Provides information about what was built, why it was built that way, and any known risks.",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a section titled 'What was built' that lists the key components and files generated for the build",
          "Displays a section titled 'Why it was built this way' that explains the rationale behind the major decisions",
          "Displays a section titled 'Known risks' that lists any identified risks and their mitigation status",
          "Content is dynamically generated based on the build details, not hardcoded"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 5,
        "rice_score": 85
      }
    ],
    "important": [
      {
        "id": "contextual_chat",
        "name": "Contextual Chat Panel",
        "description": "Allows users to ask questions about the current build in a collapsible side panel.",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Displays a collapsible side panel that is only visible when a build is selected",
          "Includes a text input field for users to ask questions about the current build",
          "Submitted questions are displayed in a chat-like interface, with responses from the system or other users",
          "Responses are generated based on the build details and information available in the dashboard"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 6,
        "rice_score": 75
      }
    ],
    "niceToHave": []
  },
  "risks": [
    {
      "risk": "Integrating with Supabase APIs and real-time updates",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "high",
      "mitigation": "Allocate sufficient time for thorough testing and debugging of the Supabase integration. Ensure robust error handling and fallback mechanisms."
    },
    {
      "risk": "Displaying a large number of agents (35) in the roster panel",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "medium",
      "mitigation": "Optimize the agent roster panel for performance, potentially using techniques like virtualization or pagination to only render visible agents."
    },
    {
      "risk": "Providing a comprehensive understanding of the build without access to the actual codebase",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "medium",
      "mitigation": "Collaborate closely with the PIXEL, WIRE, BLOCKS, FORGE, and ENGINE agents to gather the necessary information and ensure the 'Understanding Your Build' panel provides accurate and useful insights."
    }
  ]
}

decisions.choice: {"pattern":"monolith","reasoning":"The project is a single dashboard application with a focused set
decisions.reasoning: The project is a single dashboard application with a focused set of features that does not require the complexity of microservices. The monolith pattern allows for rapid development and iteration on the MVP.
